intro: Racosperma pterocaulon, commonly known as the broad-leafed acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with numerous small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are typically yellow or pale yellow, arranged in dense, globular clusters. Racosperma pterocaulon is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy and resilient species.
